explains: v. 贬低，使降级；<英>把（球队）降级；<正式>托付，交付

sentences.en: Might it not be better to relegate the king to a purely ceremonial function?
sentences.cn: 使该国王降级到一种纯粹礼仪性的职能难道不更好吗？

sentences.en: In fact, you even relegate font sizes to the proverbial dust heap, and use percentages.
sentences.cn: 事实上，甚至可以把字体大小扔到垃圾堆中，转而使用百分比。

sentences.en: McDonald knows that making such dramatic changes means you can't just relegate technology to the IT department.
sentences.cn: 麦睿博深知，要做出如此重大的转变，就意味着不能只把科技的使用局限在IT部门里。
